p: The second derivative and, consequently, the deconvoluted IR spectra of the HAp-B, HAp-L and HAp samples in the 800–1200 cm −1 spectral region indicate slight differences in the wavenumbers of the IR peaks belonging to the P–O vibrations ( Figure 5a and Figure 6a). The ν 3 fundamental vibrational mode of [PO 4] 3− group is usually formed in the 1000–1100 cm −1 range [ 25], so this implies that some interactions take place between the atoms and molecules of the HAp and basil EO structure and the HAp and lavender EO structure.
